Maeda Keijiro was a minor samurai who lived from 1540-1612. He was original=
ly born into the Takigawa clan but later was adopted by Maeda Toshihisa (Ma=
eda Toshiie's brother) when Toshihisa married Keijiro's mother. He was drum=
med out of the Maeda clan when Toshiie took over leadership from Toshihisa.=
 He resurfaced about the time of the battle of Sekigahara, fighting for the=
 Uesugi clan against the northeastern allies of the Eastern army (primarily=
 the Date, Mogami, etc) under his new name of Hyottosai Kokuzoin. He was of=
 course on the losing side and ended up becoming a ronin again, living out =
his final years in a small one room cottage. His travel journal, armor, and=
 spear are on display at one of the Uesugi castle museums-I'm pretty sure i=
t's Kasugayama-jo.
Despite having a rather bland career, he has found fame =
through kabuki performances, a popular early 90's manga series, and Koei vi=
deo games.
As to your other question, invasion of Aizu by who? Lots of figh=
ting went on there over several centuries.
